meanings.sent1: The excitative music at the party got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: The excitative movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The excitative puppy chased its tail in circles, amusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her excitative energy was like a spark igniting a fire in the room.
meanings.sent5: The excitative fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: Arousing or provoking excitement or interest.
meanings.sent1: The excitative announcement about the surprise party made her smile.
meanings.sent2: The excitative book had twists and turns that kept the reader engaged.
meanings.sent3: The excitative game of hide-and-seek had everyone laughing and running around.
meanings.sent4: His excitative storytelling painted vivid pictures in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The excitative aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen with warmth.
